## Run hotwater from the command line {.unnumbered}


### Description

Following <code>install_hotwater()</code>, the <code>hotwater</code> command can be used
to run a hotwater engine straight from the terminal. See
<code>run()</code> for further details on default values.

<code>hotwater -v</code> will provide the current version of hotwater.
<code>hotwater -h</code> will provide help text.



### Arguments

<table>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="-f">-f</code></td>
<td>
plumber file
</td></tr>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="-d">-d</code></td>
<td>
extra directories
</td></tr>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="-p">-p</code></td>
<td>
plumber port
</td></tr>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="-h">-h</code></td>
<td>
show help
</td></tr>
<tr><td style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top"><code id="--host">--host</code></td>
<td>
plumber host
</td></tr>
</table>


### See Also

<code>run()</code>



### Examples
```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, eval=TRUE}
library(hotwater)

# ```sh
# hotwater -f path/to/app.R -p 9999
# ```


```
